alert.note: Alert for Armstrong (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 17 at 9:38PM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Allegheny River At Kittanning affecting Armstrong County. Allegheny River At CW Bill Young Dam affecting Allegheny County. Allegheny River At Mosgrove affecting Armstrong County. Allegheny River At Natrona affecting Allegheny and Westmoreland Counties.
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAZ022-181600- /O.CON.KPBZ.FL.A.0005.220219T0600Z-220219T1200Z/ /MOSP1.0.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 938 PM EST Thu Feb 17 2022 ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Allegheny River at Mosgrove. * WHEN...From late Friday night to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Navigation suspended. Lock out of service. At 15.8 feet, Lock walls are overtopped. At 20.0 feet, Water begins to rise on to the road along the river in Templeton PA. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
